data.enText: the island containing England, Scotland and Wales
data.chText: 不列颠（包括英格兰、苏格兰及威尔士）

data.enText: There is no singular noun which is commonly used to refer to a person from Britain. Instead the adjective British is used.
data.chText: 英语没有指英国人的通用单数名词，一般用形容词British：

data.enText: The British have a very odd sense of humour.
data.chText: 英国人的幽默感很奇特。

data.enText: The adjective English refers only to people from England, not the rest of the United Kingdom.
data.chText: 形容词English只指英格兰人，不包括英国其他地方的人。

data.enText: The noun Briton is used mainly in newspapers.
The survivors of the avalanche included 12 Britons.
data.chText: 雪崩的幸存者中有12名英国人。

data.enText: It also describes the early inhabitants of Britain.
data.chText: 该词亦指英国早期居民：

data.enText: Brit is informal and can sound negative. Britisher is now very old-fashioned.
data.chText: Brit是非正式用语，听起来可能含贬义。Britisher现已过时。

means: 不列颠(包括英格兰、苏格兰及威尔士)

trans: 大不列颠(包括英格兰、苏格兰和威尔士)
